intro: Diabelia stenophylla var. tetrasepala, commonly known as the four-lobed diabelia, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its distinctive floral structure. The plant features showy, pale yellow flowers with four sepals, giving it its varietal name. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
